    • Field Detail

      • data

        public com.sun.jna.Pointer[] data
        < buffer data for each plane/channel
        C type : uint8_t*[8]

      • extended_data

        public com.sun.jna.ptr.PointerByReference extended_data
        pointers to the data planes/channels.
        * For video, this should simply point to data[].
        * For planar audio, each channel has a separate data pointer, and
        linesize[0] contains the size of each channel buffer.
        For packed audio, there is just one data pointer, and linesize[0]
        contains the total size of the buffer for all channels.
        * Note: Both data and extended_data will always be set, but for planar
        audio with more channels that can fit in data, extended_data must be used
        in order to access all channels.
        C type : uint8_t**

      • linesize

        public int[] linesize
        < number of bytes per line
        C type : int[8]

      • priv

        public com.sun.jna.Pointer priv
        private data to be used by a custom free function
        C type : void*

      • free

        public AVFilterBuffer.free_callback free
        A pointer to the function to deallocate this buffer if the default
        function is not sufficient. This could, for example, add the memory
        back into a memory pool to be reused later without the overhead of
        reallocating it from scratch.
        C type : free_callback*

      • format

        public int format
        < media format

      • w

        public int w
        < width and height of the allocated buffer

      • h

        public int h
        < width and height of the allocated buffer

      • refcount

        public int refcount
        < number of references to this buffer

      • AVFilterBuffer

      • AVFilterBuffer

        public AVFilterBuffer(com.sun.jna.Pointer[] data,
              com.sun.jna.ptr.PointerByReference extended_data,
              int[] linesize,
              com.sun.jna.Pointer priv,
              AVFilterBuffer.free_callback free,
              int format,
              int w,
              int h,
              int refcount)
        Parameters:
        data - < buffer data for each plane/channel
        C type : uint8_t*[8]
        extended_data - pointers to the data planes/channels.
        * For video, this should simply point to data[].
        * For planar audio, each channel has a separate data pointer, and
        linesize[0] contains the size of each channel buffer.
        For packed audio, there is just one data pointer, and linesize[0]
        contains the total size of the buffer for all channels.
        * Note: Both data and extended_data will always be set, but for planar
        audio with more channels that can fit in data, extended_data must be used
        in order to access all channels.
        C type : uint8_t**
        linesize - < number of bytes per line
        C type : int[8]
        priv - private data to be used by a custom free function
        C type : void*
        free - A pointer to the function to deallocate this buffer if the default
        function is not sufficient. This could, for example, add the memory
        back into a memory pool to be reused later without the overhead of
        reallocating it from scratch.
        C type : free_callback*
        format - < media format
        w - < width and height of the allocated buffer
        h - < width and height of the allocated buffer
        refcount - < number of references to this buffer
